website_summaries.verdict: It's an acceptable choice for small tots, but we recommend others we reviewed for their quality and versatility.
pros: Sports a built-in splash guard and easy-to-grip handles
Padded seat removes when it's time to advance to an adult toilet
cons: The plastic construction doesn't feel very durable, and the seat is on the small side

customer_reviews.title: this was the 3rd potty I purchased but the one he enjoyed sitting on the most (despite it being the "shortest)
customer_reviews.text: This has made the world of difference for my son, this was the 3rd potty I purchased but the one he enjoyed sitting on the most (despite it being the "shortest). It was now fun going potty and in a few days he was trained. tHe best part is that the seat fits onto a regular (small no long oval) size toilet seat. Perfect fit for him. And the yellow cushion helps a lot, one complaint from the other 2 potties was that after a few minutes the hard plastic was difficult to sit on... not this potty!
customer_reviews.author: ADR

customer_reviews.title: Decent looks, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the look of this potty, which is a great advantage when trying to convince him to use it. However, the yellow portion of the seat is just a flimsy piece of foam that moves around and hardly stays in place. And you can't just get rid of this piece because it has the "guard" to keep little boys from peeing all over the floor. Then to empty the basin after its use, you have to disassemble the seat. This is a tedious process that is even more difficult with your little one is trying the "help."
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ash

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Small
customer_reviews.text: This potty is waaayyyyy smaller than I expected. If your child is older than six months, then this may not be the potty for you. However, it is super cute. My grandson told me that he wanted to pee in "Marshall". The fireman character on Paw Patrol. lol
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: This Fire Truck Potty Won't Save You
customer_reviews.text: This really cute potty is pretty useless, unless your child is small. Mine is not and he enjoys playing with it much more than peeing in it. If your child is over 2.5 or 3 yrs old, she or he will likely find this potty uncomfortable to sit on, as it is SO LOW to the ground, one's knees are in one's face. Also, it comes apart in several pieces, so if you are emptying it, be careful (yikes!) as it could spill or come apart on you. A cute design, but made with very little practicality.
customer_reviews.author: N. Guest

customer_reviews.title: Very low to the ground chair - good for shorter kids!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a firetruck lover that needs potty training this is for you! Our twin boys loved this. I will say this is a very low potty chair so it is better for our child that is shorter. Our taller child has a harder time fitting on this because it is so low to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: PGR RB

customer_reviews.title: Very low to the ground... could be a plus or a minue
customer_reviews.text: My son is obsessed with firemen and trucks but this potty is so low to the ground. It's really hard for him to sit on. Maybe that is what they need to get more in a sqauting position but my son really doesn't like sitting on it. From the picture it looks like the seat is yellow but its actually grey and has a little yellow foam cover. That cover does not stay in place so really its just there to confuse my child and help spread pee everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Walker

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Only gave it a 1 BC I couldn't rate it lower. It looks really cool but it's garbage. The yellow foam seat is thinner than a piece of craft foam, plus it's porous so germs can be harbored even when cleaned. The seat and bowl both need to be cleaned and the lip on the seat is really annoying. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybugturtle

customer_reviews.title: Great Potty for Potty Training
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this potty. We received a hand me down potty from a family member that he just wouldn't take to but the moment we got this potty, potty training got easier. Within a week he was using this potty with very little accidents. I worried he would see it as a toy and want to play with it more than use it but it worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Adorable.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this potty seat. It looks exactly as shown in the pics. It's super adorable. My son loves it. My only issue is that it is small, as in not very tall. I will not remove stars for that because my son is actually rather tall for his age (90th percentile). I think it would be a perfect sized seat for other children trying to potty train. My son still uses this seat to potty train, he just has to sit with his legs straight out, but that doesn't seem to bother him. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I received this potty yesterday and I put it right back into the box. I wish I would have read more reviews. The yellow is so soft and flimsy. I tried to have my son sit on it, and he would not. He would leave the yellow piece on. (Bought this seat for grandmas house. We have the Bjorn seat for our house that he uses regularly). Without the Yello foam there is no pee gaurd. Not good for boys! I also didn't like the Yello because it would be hard to clean. Being a foam it would be porous and hold smell.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Cute first time potty
customer_reviews.text: I really like this potty because my son is a fire truck fan and it can be use on a full size toilet. However, I do have a few complaints about the seat and size. The seat is made of foam and falls off. For some reason the block doesn't keep his pee in the potty and renders it useless at time (could be user error). The size makes me worry that there is not much more growing room and fear I will have to purchase another potty once he grows out of it or the foam is destroyed. So far, so good
customer_reviews.author: C.M. Gilham

customer_reviews.title: Cute, easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Cute. Wish the yellow pad was rubber or something, it's a terrible design and a useless feature. It easily ripped apart in a couple days and was thrown away. Also wish there was a higher lip on the front of the actual potty seat for boys. Nice design with seat detachable to use on a big potty and cup is easy removed to empty the contents and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: No so great
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 yrs old picked this out himself. After trying 2 others that he hated I let him pick. He loved it and was anxious to sit on it. Sadly it's not that great. The yellow part is flimsy foam and it keeps messing up and sticks to him. It also has another part you have to take off to get to the bucket part. Too complicated for me. I have 4 children and like simple..
customer_reviews.author: Spring4

customer_reviews.title: Cute But Way Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very cute but cheaply made. The yellow seat cushion was very thin and flimsy and wouldn't have survived my son's pulling at it while pottying. I was disappointed because i was looking forward to having a cute training toilet that was all boy since I've potty trained two girls before him. I have returned it and will be buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Also better packaging as ours came creased straight out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: The guard is way too low for boys, so pee gets everywhere. The foam is very thin so if he sits on it for a few minutes he winds up getting a red booty from the pressure. I would suggest a higher guard on the foam and softer more malleable material for it. Also better packaging as ours came creased straight out of the package. Otherwise the look is great.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Potty was cute we purchased it because of the seat that attached to the toilet as he grew. Unfortunately we are very disappointed and plan to send it back. The "high splash guard" is nothing more than a flimsy piece of foam that sits on top on the seat. The piece isn't attached to anything and is easily torn. The hard plastic seat has no splash guard of its own. The concept is cute but poorly made and not at all functional.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Really people?!
customer_reviews.text: See that cute little yellow padding on the seat? It's cheap STYROFOAM. Flimsier than foam plates. It reminds me of the yellow styrofoam trays they out the hamburger in at the deli only it's even junkier than that. And to top it off, as soon as we opened the package my 1.5 year old bit the pee stopper part at the front so now it's officially not getting returned!
customer_reviews.author: TKelsh

customer_reviews.title: My 2 1/2 year old son loves this
customer_reviews.text: This is a great potty for any kid who likes "woo woo"s as my son calls firemen. It's easy to take apart to clean and looks cute too. My only complaint would be its low to the ground, but my son is super tall for his age so maybe this won't affect all kids.
customer_reviews.author: Vitac08

customer_reviews.title: Messy Messy Messy!
customer_reviews.text: Cute concept but fell short on functionality. Potty just isn't deep enough. Splashed messes after each use, child became frustrated with it, along with mom! Making to the potty in time was not the problem, still ended up cleaning up floor after each use. Stick with the Summer Infant model. Better design.
customer_reviews.author: Nanablue

customer_reviews.title: Whats with the yellow foam insert?
customer_reviews.text: What were they thinking by making the boys yellow seat insert just a flimsy foam piece? It is terrible. It moves a lot and isnt sturdy at all. If not for that we wld like it more. My 3 yr old son dsnt seem too big for it. He is 37in 31 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Adel mam

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this seat, but the foam topper ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this seat, but the foam topper with the pee guard lasted only a few weeks before it was missing bites out of it from both the toddler and the dog I wish it was more durable. He uses the potty without the foam, but this was dissapointing as the pee guard aspect is what originally sold me on the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Edifers

customer_reviews.title: My twin 21 month old grandsons are interested in cars ...
customer_reviews.text: My twin 21 month old grandsons are interested in cars about and planes. The fire truck is what was needed to keep them interested in learning to potty. I ordered a second one to prevent arguments. The only part of the chair is the yellow seat cover which is flimsy. The rest of the chair is reasonably well built. Nd
customer_reviews.author: cecil taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but don't love the seat
customer_reviews.text: My son loves fire trucks, so loves the fire truck potty... Unfortunately though I did not realize that the yellow seat is merely a piece of foam that sits on the gray seat base. My toddler wants to take it off each time which removes the splash guard completely. Makes it a little messier than a seat with a more permanent guard. I think I should have read the description closer to learn this before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KimJ

customer_reviews.title: Cute potty seat
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this potty seat but.... I agree with the other reviewers about the weird yellow foam protector. I ended up just throwing it away . My son uses his potty without it and doesnt seem to mind at all.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Silva

customer_reviews.title: Looking for something SIMPLE? This is your product.
customer_reviews.text: An alright product. We decided to get something low price because my brother will just use it for a while and then leave it. This product is cute, the only thing I do not like it the yellow foam. It moves around too much and not that useful.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar

customer_reviews.title: Even cheaper quality in person than pictured.
customer_reviews.text: The yellow foam is very flimsy and not permanently attached to the seat. My kid takes it off and carries it around and I'm surprised it hasn't ripped yet. Regardless, it's very unsanitary, so I've gotten rid of the foam. Without the foam, the plastic seat does not have a lip to block the pee from a little boy. Not what I wanted at all.
customer_reviews.author: B. Daee

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed when we got this. Not only was it very tiny, but the yellow foam pad was very flimsy. And to make me dislike this seat even more, there are 3 separate pieces that need to be removed and washed...every...time...my son goes potty. Seruously, who has that much time?! We quickly swiched to a 2 piece potty chair. 😕
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a little hard to put back together each time.
customer_reviews.author: Misha Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Cute AND functional!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little item for a boy whose daddy is a firefighter. Little visitors are envious! It's very nice and solid in addition to being cute. Our daughter got one for their house after her little guy flipped for it here. It cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: mmbrownie

customer_reviews.title: Only a 3-alarm
customer_reviews.text: Super fun for boys who love fire trucks and not potty training ... but from the POV of the person who has to empty the potty, it's kind of a pain to take all the little parts off the bowl first. I like our other one better since the bowl is just one simple piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jill C

customer_reviews.title: and pretty much worthless
customer_reviews.text: Splash guard is flimsy, and pretty much worthless. It says the seats converts to fit inside the actual toilet, but it doesn't, even if it did, it's hard plastic and I would never use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for girls, splash guard is worthless
customer_reviews.text: The yellow splash shield is made of foam and always sticks to my son's bottom as he stands up. It does not stay in place when he sits down either. This potty would be fine for a girl, since girls could use it without the splash guard, but I think most people would be purchashing this for a boy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: The yellow topper is difficult to clean and falls off ...
customer_reviews.text: The yellow topper is difficult to clean and falls off. It also moves, so sometimes (if you have a boy), if they don't hold it down it can spray. =)
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Very cute but a little short from front to back ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cute but a little short from front to back for boys- a fair amount of squirting up over the front unless you hold the " hose" down.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: easy to clean, 2.5 year old was excited about the firetruck. I threw away the yellow foam part bc it was NOT easy to keep clean and was just an extra part in the way
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: It's a very badly put together potty. It looks nice but it's utterly nonfunctional: the "seat" (which is actually a piece of Styrofoam) doesn't stay in place, the front guard is not high enough to prevent the child from peeing outside the potty and the overall potty is just too low. Would not recommend it or buy it again if I knew.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and colorful. This was given as a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very bright and colorful. This was given as a gift so I cannot review the item directly but have heard no complaints from the recipient.
customer_reviews.author: Clint S.

customer_reviews.title: Sticky Seat
customer_reviews.text: So cute, but i am having trouble with the yellow squish seat. It sticks to my little one so either you sit right the first time or it is a big ordeal to adjust position.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine R.

customer_reviews.title: Fire Potty
customer_reviews.text: My grandson calls it the "fire potty." He has used it only once, but I think he will train easily when we become determined. This is cute and looks comfortable for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Best money ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: From all reports, my grandson loves his potty chair. He was a late bloomer, but this chair broke the ice.
customer_reviews.author: Aspro-naut

customer_reviews.title: Dont reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Little pee pee holder pad thing doesnt help at all. It just slides around and falls off constantly. If your child is bigger, they will not fit well on this.
customer_reviews.author: April  Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Too bad...toooooooo small.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cute potty, but we have two complaints. It's a little flimsy compared to the other one we have. And it's way too small!! Now, my son is big, but I don't see how any boy could manage this thing. Plus the foam cushion comes off. I found my daughter trying to put it over her head as a hat...yuck. It even easily comes off when my son sits on it. They should have Velcro or something to stick it down. Big disappointment. My son won't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, and fun for the little one to learn the potty detail
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Finney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and fun for little kids starting to go potty. My grandson will love this.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Reimer

customer_reviews.title: i feel like it holds pee onto it
customer_reviews.text: the yellow seat cushion is a weird material. i feel like it holds pee onto it, meaning its not very sanitary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I was disappointed about was the yellow cushion part of the seat
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his potty seat. The only thing I was disappointed about was the yellow cushion part of the seat, it is very flimsy and thin, it tore in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jessblaze2288

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun design but it sits too low to the ground and is flimsy. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kim K.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The yellow cover is just a flimsy foam that I'm sure won't last long. If my grandson didn't love fire trucks so much I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Loves to Read

customer_reviews.title: The guard on the front is useless!
customer_reviews.text: This potty is tiny! It is meant to be for a very young child under 2. The guard on the front is useless!
customer_reviews.author: M Elizabeth Guajardo

customer_reviews.title: It was easily deformed by our
customer_reviews.text: Yellow seat is just foam. It's not attached or very durable. It was easily deformed by our toddler
customer_reviews.author: ladonna

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but not as good as it looks.
customer_reviews.text: While the seat is really good and cute. The yellow "padding" for the seat is thin as paper, and a boy can't really sit on the potty without the yellow padding.
customer_reviews.author: Christie F

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: so cute it's for my grandson who's dad is a firefighter
customer_reviews.author: Diana Coats

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Design is awesome, my son does not care for it though, but the splash guard is a joke! Tinies splashguard (1,5 finger width) There's pee all over my floor!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: If you have a girl the potty will work great. I have a boy and the yellow foam ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have a girl the potty will work great. I have a boy and the yellow foam part of the training potty doesn't catch the pee from going out of the potty. Also when my son gets up off the potty the yellow foam sticks to his butt. Overall wasn't impressed should have just got a standard training potty that is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: My son picked this out himself. After battling him ...
customer_reviews.text: My son picked this out himself. After battling him for weeks with potty training I finally bought a "truck potty". It's very cute & he likes using it. My only complaint is the yellow part of the seat is a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Fire engine potty
customer_reviews.text: Cute sturdy potty chair. Only problem is he wants the wheels to move so he can ride it. I hope he uses it for its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: pattygay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 3 year old son loved it. Did say he tough it was small.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Parks-Kooistra

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome potty chair. Removed the foam thing for boys as we are potty training a girl.
customer_reviews.author: DamselfyLuv

customer_reviews.title: Cheap seat
customer_reviews.text: The yellow section of the seat is made of very cheap very thin foam.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and practical
customer_reviews.text: This is too cute. My son loves it. Fun and practical.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Arreola

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this potty for my grandson and it is adorable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this potty for my grandson and it is adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Wright

customer_reviews.title: Potty guard too low
customer_reviews.text: It would be perfect if the potty guard for boys was higher. My little boy's stream went right over the top every time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Adorable little potty. If your child likes fire trucks, this is the potty to use!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Wished the wheels could have been able to spin my ...
customer_reviews.text: Wished the wheels could have been able to spin my lost interest when he realised it couldnt he really loves cars
customer_reviews.author: House Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Multiple layers make it difficult to clean. Yellow seat pad is thin and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: SaraS

customer_reviews.title: Yellow piece is foam...choking hazard!
customer_reviews.text: The yellow piece is foam. Which is a major choking hazard. The first thing my son did was pull it off the seat and put it right in his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The cushion part is very slim and removable which does not fare well with little ones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The yellow piece you see in the photo is a cheap foam/rubber piece. I would def. not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie

customer_reviews.title: Cute potty seat. my son loves it. Still ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute potty seat. my son loves it. Still trying to get him to figure out what it is for. lol
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! Helped train my little boy in no time.. Thank you!! 😀
customer_reviews.author: Albert B.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best seat for Boys.
customer_reviews.text: sadly this seat didn't work out for us. I put this fire truck potty seat back in the box after an hour of getting it. The yellow seat is a flimsy soft foam and I see it being ruined in days. The seat is 4 pieces and my son wanted to take it apart and put it back together. Also I have a boy and the seat is pretty low to the ground and his legs are in his chest when he sat on it. If the yellow seat part wasn't there there wouldn't be a piece to cover his boy parts when he pees.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It looks very nice. But my son thinks it is a toy and only plays with it.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Danilov

customer_reviews.title: No thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Seat is not good for a boy! My little one kept taking the yellow foam top off. Only used it for one day & went to buy a better potty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The yellow foam is filmsy and it only came with 2 wheels
customer_reviews.author: venise sanders

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.text: The yellow seating part is thin foam. Do not like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves the design of this little potty and it has helped us so much to get him interested in going on the potty! I love the way it transitions from potty to toilet, however I expected the yellow cushion to be much more sturdy and durable. Its really just a layer of thin foam. I can't imagine that is very comfortable for a toddler who is spending a lot of time sitting as he learns how to go.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Roberts

customer_reviews.title: ... training potty systems and this is by far the best; my son
customer_reviews.text: We bougth 3 different training potty systems and this is by far the best; my son, who is a big boy, loves it.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome! My two year old loves to use the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! My two year old loves to use the fire truck potty. The yellow lip is perfect for little boys, and the pop off seat does fit nicely on our toilet (elongated bowl style). I highly recommend this seat! Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Superzeret

customer_reviews.title: Looks too much like a toy.
customer_reviews.text: The detachable foam piece is very distracting to my toddler, who immediately wants to get up off of the potty and play with the foam. My boy thinks that this colorful potty is a toy, and wants to push it around like a car. If your child gets distracted easily, you might want to go for a potty that is more "boring" and has less pieces to take apart.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Rodriguez

product_meta.title: The First Years Hero in Training 2-in-1 Potty System
product_meta.description: Potty training doesn’t need to be a three-alarm fire! Make it fun with the Hero in Training Potty System, offering fire truck appeal for your little hero and lots of "hot" features for you. The system starts as a standalone potty with a soft foam ring and then transitions to a detachable seat that you can place on your family toilet. With a lift-out pot for easy cleaning and a high pee shield for less mess, this easy-to-clean potty will get your family all fired up about training!
feature_bullets: 2-in-1 potty system offers a removable trainer seat that fits on the family toilet
Soft easy to clean cushion with high pee shield for less mess
Lift-out pot for easy emptying and cleaning

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars156 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
